abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Reproductive and Child Health Project for India is to expand
            the use of essential reproductive and child health services
            of adequate quality with reduction of geographical
            disparities. The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
            (MOHFW) has requested, through the Department of Economic
            Affairs (DEA), a re-allocation among expenditure categories.
            The reallocation would provide additional funds for category
            one (b) required to support a larger share of financing for
            State level eligible expenditures based on 2010-11 audited
            expenditures. This will involve reallocating undisbursed
            balances from categories one (a) (central procurement); two
            (polio eradication activities); three (procurement agents
            fees); and four (governance accountability action plan),
            which total SDR 50,355,000 to category one (b) other
            eligible project activities. This reallocation will enable
            MOHFW to fully utilize the IDA credit against eligible
            program expenditures.
